Interface GraphPlus<T>

All Known Implementing Classes:
AdjMatGraphPlus
public interface GraphPlus<T>

          Inserts an edge between two vertices of this graph, if the vertices exist.

          Adds a vertex to this graph, associating object with vertex.

 GraphPlus<T> clone()
          [10 pts] Clones the graph by saving the current one on the disk as TEMP.tgf using saveTGF() and creating a new one using the second constructor.

          [10 pts] Returns a LinkedList contining a DEPTH first search traversal of the graph starting at the given index.
 LinkedList<T> getPredecessors(T vertex)
          Retrieve from a graph the vertices x pointing to vertex v (x->v) and returns them onto a linked list
 LinkedList<T> getSuccessors(T vertex)
          Retrieve from a graph the vertices x following vertex v (v->x) and returns them onto a linked list
 boolean isArc(T vertex1, T vertex2)
          Returns true iff a directed edge exists from v1 to v2.
 boolean isEdge(T vertex1, T vertex2)
          Returns true iff an edge exists between two given vertices which means that two corresponding arcs exist in the graph
 boolean isEmpty()
          Returns true if this graph is empty, false otherwise.
 boolean isIsolated(T vertex)
          [5 pts] Checks if a vertex is a isolated, that is, it is neither pointing to another vertex nor is pointed by one
 boolean isSink(T vertex)
          [10 pts] Checks if a vertex is a sink (points to no other vertex)
 boolean isSource(T vertex)
          [10 pts] Checks if a vertex is a source (no vertex points to it)
 boolean isUndirected()
          Returns true IFF the graph is undirected, that is, for every pair of nodes i,j for which there is an arc, the opposite arc is also present in the graph.
 int m()
          Returns the number of arcs in this graph.
 int n()
          Returns the number of vertices in this graph.
 void removeArc(T vertex1, T vertex2)
          Removes an arc from vertex v1 to vertex v2, if the vertices exist.
 void removeEdge(T vertex1, T vertex2)
          Removes an edge between two vertices of this graph, if the vertices exist, else does not change the graph.
 void removeVertex(T vertex)
          Removes a single vertex with the given value from this graph.
 void saveTGF(String tgf_file_name)
          Saves the current graph into a .tgf file.
 LinkedList<T> topologicalSort()
          [15 pts] Topologically sort vertices of a directed acyclic graph using one of the two algorithms presented in class.
 String toString()
          Returns a string representation of the adjacency matrix.

Returns true if this graph is empty, false otherwise.

Returns the number of vertices in this graph.

Returns the number of arcs in this graph.

              T vertex2)

isEdge

boolean isEdge(T vertex1,
               T vertex2)
Returns true iff an edge exists between two given vertices which means that two corresponding arcs exist in the graph

isUndirected

boolean isUndirected()
Returns true IFF the graph is undirected, that is, for every pair of nodes i,j for which there is an arc, the opposite arc is also present in the graph.

addVertex

void addVertex(T vertex)
Adds a vertex to this graph, associating object with vertex. If the vertex already exists, nothing is inserted.

removeVertex

void removeVertex(T vertex)
Removes a single vertex with the given value from this graph. If the vertex does not exist, it does not change the graph.

addArc

void addArc(T vertex1,
            T vertex2)
Inserts an arc from vertex1 to vertex2. If the vertices exist. Else it does not change the graph.

removeArc

void removeArc(T vertex1,
               T vertex2)
Removes an arc from vertex v1 to vertex v2, if the vertices exist. Else it does not change the graph.

addEdge

void addEdge(T vertex1,
             T vertex2)
Inserts an edge between two vertices of this graph, if the vertices exist. Else does not change the graph.

removeEdge

void removeEdge(T vertex1,
                T vertex2)
Removes an edge between two vertices of this graph, if the vertices exist, else does not change the graph.

Returns a string representation of the adjacency matrix.

Overrides:
toString in class Object

saveTGF

void saveTGF(String tgf_file_name)
Saves the current graph into a .tgf file. If it cannot save the file, a message is printed.

clone

GraphPlus<T> clone()
[10 pts] Clones the graph by saving the current one on the disk as TEMP.tgf using saveTGF() and creating a new one using the second constructor.

Returns:
the new graph. FEATURE: It does not try to delete the file from the disk

topologicalSort

LinkedList<T> topologicalSort()
[15 pts] Topologically sort vertices of a directed acyclic graph using one of the two algorithms presented in class. PREREQUISITE: The input graph must be a DAG, i.e., have NO CYCLES.

Returns:
the topologically sorted vertices in a linked list

DFS

LinkedList<T> DFS(T vertex)
[10 pts] Returns a LinkedList contining a DEPTH first search traversal of the graph starting at the given index. If the index is not valid, it returns an empty list. You can use as a starting point the pseudocode in the handout or the Iterator code in the book.

Returns:
a linked list with the vertices in depth-first order

BFS

LinkedList<T> BFS(T vertex)
[10 pts] Returns a LinkedList contining a BREADTH first search traversal of a graph starting at the given index. If the index is not valid, it returns an empty list You can use as a starting point the pseudocode in the handout or the Iterator code in the book.

Returns:
a linked list with the vertices in breadth-first order
